heading: 4 Unidimensional Continuous Variables
text: chapter, demonstrate types graphs using ggplot2.

heading: 4.1.1 Basics and implications
text:
start easy example.
example, used geom_histogram create histogram variable x. can see quick make need much pre-processing. Moreover, Histograms show data’s empirical distribution within set intervals suggest using one first steps understand data.Note: shown , ggplot expects dataframe, make sure throw vector ggplot.
code:
library(ggplot2)
library(gridExtra)

#Example data
x <- c(50, 51, 53, 55, 56, 60, 65, 65, 68)
#Stored as a dataframe
df <- data.frame(x)

ggplot(df, aes(x)) +
  geom_histogram(color = "grey", fill = "lightBlue", binwidth = 5, center = 52.5) +
  ggtitle("ggplot2 histogram of x")

heading: 4.1.2 Types of Histograms
text: y-scale histograms can represented variety ways express different results:Frequency count: y = number values fall binRelative frequency: y = number values fall bin / total number valuesCumulative frequency: y = total number values <= (<) right boundary binDensity: y = relative frequency / binwidth

heading: 4.1.3.1 Bin boundaries
text: mindful boundaries bins whether point fall left right bin boundary. can use parameter closed control intervals.
code:
p1 <- ggplot(df, aes(x)) +
  geom_histogram(color="blue",fill="lightblue", binwidth = 5, center = 52.5, closed="left")  +
  ggtitle("Left Closed graph")

p2 <- ggplot(df, aes(x)) +
  geom_histogram(color="blue",fill="lightblue", binwidth = 5, center = 52.5, closed="right")  +
  ggtitle("Right Closed graph")

grid.arrange(p1, p2, ncol = 2)

heading: 4.1.3.2 Bin numbers
text:
start passing parameters geom_histogram notice pop-saying default number bins 30.
see graph ideal gaps. two ways modify number bins: specify width explicitly binwidth provide desired number bins bins. Consider following modifications:Note: gold standard number bins, try different numbers generate best results.
code:
library(Sleuth3)
finches <- Sleuth3::case0201

#Default 
ggplot(finches, aes(x = Depth)) +
  geom_histogram() +
  ggtitle("Default with pop-up about bin number")
# using binwidth
p3 <- ggplot(finches, aes(x = Depth)) +
  geom_histogram(color="blue",fill="lightblue",binwidth = 0.5, boundary = 6) +
  ggtitle("Changed binwidth value")

# using bins
p4 <- ggplot(finches, aes(x = Depth)) +
  geom_histogram(color="blue",fill="lightblue",bins = 15, boundary = 6) +
  ggtitle("Changed bin value")

# format plot layout
grid.arrange(p3, p4, ncol = 2)

heading: 4.1.3.3 Bin alignment
text: Consider comparisonNotice boundary bins start axis difference code removal boundry. control position bins, can use either parameter center boundary. can use boundary specify endpoint bin center specify center bin ggplot2 able calculate place rest bins. (Also, notice boundary changed, number bins got smaller one. default bins centered go /range data.) example, specify boundary 6. can see first bin starts 6 position bins calculated based binwidth 0.5.
code:
p5 <- ggplot(finches, aes(x = Depth)) +
  geom_histogram(color="blue",fill="lightblue",binwidth = 0.5) +
  ggtitle("Without alignment")

p6 <- ggplot(finches, aes(x = Depth)) +
  geom_histogram(color="blue",fill="lightblue",bins = 15, boundary = 6) +
  ggtitle("With alignment")

grid.arrange(p5, p6, ncol = 2)

heading: 4.1.4 Interactive histograms with ggvis
text: ggvis package currently development, certain things well, adjusting parameters histogram interactively coding. interested, refer https://ggvis.rstudio.com/ggvis-basics.html.
